Intel ® Integrated Performance Primitives
USC AMRWB codec

Overview
USC Codec description
 

Overview

The USC AMRWB speech codec is compliant with 3GPP TS 26.190-192,194,201 specifications for Adaptive Multi-Rate WideBand codec promoted 3rd Generation Partnership Project ( www.3gpp.org ) and has been implemented using the Intel ® Integrated Performance Primitives (Intel ® IPP) Speech Coding functions. The USC AMRWB codec supports 16bit wideband 16000 Hz PCM signal compression and decompression with 20ms frame length at nine bitrates 6600, 8850, 12650, 14250, 15850, 18250, 19850, 23050 or 23850  bps producing 132, 177, 253, 285, 317, 365, 397, 461 or 477 bits per frame (bpf) respectively.  

USC AMRWB codec is compatible with 3GPP TS 26.173 v5.9.0 (2004-12) ANSI-C Code.

Additional information on this software as well as other Intel ® Software Development Products is available at http://developer.intel.com/software/products/ .

USC Codec description

For USC Interface description refer to USC manual. 

 

USC AMRWB codec parameters:

  • Codec name: IPP_AMRWB

  • Compression algorithm: Multi-Rate WideBand Algebraic Code Excited Linear Prediction  ( MRWB-ACELP )

  • Linkage: USC_AMRWB_Fxns

  • Sampling: 16bit linear 16000 Hz

  • Frame: 20ms

  • Bitrates: 6600 bps (132 bpf), 8850 bps (177 bpf), 12650 bps (253 bpf), 14250 bps (285 bpf), 15850 bps (317 bpf), 18250 bps (365 bpf), 19850 bps (397 bpf), 23050 bps (461 bpf), 23850  bps (477 bpf);  SID - 35 bpf

  • Voice Activity Detection: VAD supported

  • Packet Loss Concealment: PLC supported

  • Frame type (value): TX_NON_SPEECH (-1), TX_SPEECH_GOOD (0), TX_SID_FIRST(1), TX_SID_UPDATE (2), TX_NO_DATA (3), TX_SPEECH_ PROBABLY_DEGRADED (4), TX_SPEECH_LOST (5), TX_SPEECH_BAD (6), TX_SID_BAD (7)

  • Standards: 3GPP TS 26.190-192,194
